name: Education Funding
title: Stalled Education Reform Bill Would Raise Taxes and Spending for Some Districts, Cut Them for Others - The Montpelier Bridge
description: H.454, a state bill that has held up adjournment of the Legislature until at least June 16, would — if it passes — lead to significant school spending and tax changes later this decade for residents of many school districts, including those in central Vermont. In an attempt to control school property taxes in an era when student numbers are declining, the bill proposes to radically change the ways schools are funded in Vermont. It would also alter the size and number of school districts in the state.  As of press time, H.454 was stuck in a House-Senate conference committee.
